subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: [[者]] (borrowing its sound 자(ja)) + [[乙]] (used as marker to represent the last consonant [[ㄹ]], because of their similarity in shape). One of the ''[[음역자|eumyeokja]]'' ("character for transliteration") used in the {{w|Idu script}} for Korean 잘.

subSections.title: Hanja
subSections.text:
{{ko-hanja|hangeul=잘|rv=jal|mr=chal|y=cal}}

# Used in Honorific title of [[w:Seongjong of Joseon|King Seongjong of Joseon]] as he was a prince. (乽山君; 잘산군, Jalsangun; Chalsan'gun, ''Prince Jalsan'')
